posts.post_content: This is not just an average reanimator spell for the fair cost of 5, this is an INSTANT-SPEED reanimator spell! Enabling huge combos and interactions. Triggering and retriggering ETB and LTB effects. Also, I love how it punishes control: you're in the late-game and the control opponent is on the denial path. He taps out to countera small utility creature and this is your response. That's shattering Hope this will survive the torment of [Scavenging Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scavenging Ooze) and [Rest in Peace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rest in Peace) in standard.
posts.html:

Posted By: Blasphemale (9/18/2013 8:10:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ignore for a moment the beautiful flavour of this card... I know, I can't either.  
  
Anyway! The point I wanna make is this is an incredibly powerful card for value. On death, leave the battlefield and enter the battlefield triggers make it crazy. If an opponent uses any kind of removal or negative enchantment on your creature this dodges/removes it. Sac [Thragtusk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thragtusk) targetted [Annihilate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Annihilate), bringing back [restoration angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=restoration angel)...   
  
Unfortunately this isn't flash because they come back during the upkeep and have summoning sickness. But in a slower format, such as Theros block (or what it appears to be right now) that's not too terrible a thing. If you simply use it on two creatures with haste the downside is gone.
posts.html:
Ignore for a moment the beautiful flavour of this card... I know, I can't either.

Anyway! The point I wanna make is this is an incredibly powerful card for value. On death, leave the battlefield and enter the battlefield triggers make it crazy. If an opponent uses any kind of removal or negative enchantment on your creature this dodges/removes it. Sac Thragtusk targetted Annihilate, bringing back restoration angel...

Unfortunately this isn't flash because they come back during the upkeep and have summoning sickness. But in a slower format, such as Theros block (or what it appears to be right now) that's not too terrible a thing. If you simply use it on two creatures with haste the downside is gone.

posts.post_content:
Awesome prerelease play I pulled off with this card:  
  
I have a [Loathsome Catoblepas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loathsome Catoblepas) out. On my opponent's turn, I cast this, saccing the Catoblepas and take out one of his guys. On my upkeep, I get the Catoblepas and [Pharika's Mender](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pharika's Mender) back, who also gets me back a [Reaper of the Wilds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reaper of the Wilds), which I have more than enough mana to pay for. That was just awesome!

Posted By: BryceCarmony (9/26/2013 6:48:03 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Great flavor and great card. Initially I thought this card was somewhat slow, but I didn't realize the in-set combo. What it lacks in speed, it makes up in persistence. This card was part of an amazing sealed deck of mine with a [mnemonic wall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mnemonic wall).   
  
It made all of my turns full of value. Every single turn I was able to reanimate my wall and another creature, and get the rescue from the underworld back of course. And my [champion of stray souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=champion of stray souls) made it even harder to stop this combo.  
  
Excellent card. It's not fast, but it makes up for that by being generally awesome.
posts.html:
Great flavor and great card. Initially I thought this card was somewhat slow, but I didn't realize the in-set combo. What it lacks in speed, it makes up in persistence. This card was part of an amazing sealed deck of mine with a mnemonic wall.

It made all of my turns full of value. Every single turn I was able to reanimate my wall and another creature, and get the rescue from the underworld back of course. And my champion of stray souls made it even harder to stop this combo.

Excellent card. It's not fast, but it makes up for that by being generally awesome.

Posted By: cotf1692 (3/28/2014 4:10:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm really surprised this doesn't specify "under its owner's control". This way you can steal your opponents creatures permanently if you have a temporary effect like [Act of Treason](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Act of Treason) on them.  
Normally this effect is only seen on "fast blinks" like [Cloudshift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudshift), [Ghostly Flicker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghostly Flicker), [Restoration Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Restoration Angel), [Conjurer's Closet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conjurer's Closet), and [Deadeye Navigator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deadeye Navigator), while "owner's control" is generally seen on "slow blinks" like [Ghostway](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghostway), [Momentary Blink](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Momentary Blink), [Vanish into Memory](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vanish into Memory), [Voidwalk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voidwalk), [Galepowder Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Galepowder Mage), and even [Obzedat, Ghost Council](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obzedat, Ghost Council). The only exception I know of to this is [Venser, the Sojourner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser, the Sojourner).  
There are a good number of ways to permanently steal creatures when they die ([False Demise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=False Demise), [Fool's Demise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fool's Demise), autoca... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I'm really surprised this doesn't specify "under its owner's control". This way you can steal your opponents creatures permanently if you have a temporary effect like Act of Treason on them.
Normally this effect is only seen on "fast blinks" like Cloudshift, Ghostly Flicker, Restoration Angel, Conjurer's Closet, and Deadeye Navigator, while "owner's control" is generally seen on "slow blinks" like Ghostway, Momentary Blink, Vanish into Memory, Voidwalk, Galepowder Mage, and even Obzedat, Ghost Council. The only exception I know of to this is Venser, the Sojourner.
There are a good number of ways to permanently steal creatures when they die (False Demise, Fool's Demise, autoca... (see all)

posts.post_content: I desperately want to use this in my [Karador](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karador) sacrifice for value EDH deck. It sacs a creature, which works with [Grave Pact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Pact), [Martyr's Bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Martyr's Bond), [Savra, Queen of the Golgari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Savra, Queen of the Golgari) (if you sacrifice a black creature, mainly), and LTB effects like [Solemn Simulacrum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Solemn Simulacrum). And then it reanimates, which is great with ETBs like (again) [Solemn Simulacrum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Solemn Simulacrum), [Angel of Despair](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel of Despair), [Ashen Rider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashen Rider), and [Sylvan Primo](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sylvan Primo)—oh, wait. Problem is, I can't find room for it. I think this one may have to wait for now.
posts.html:
I desperately want to use this in my Karador sacrifice for value EDH deck. It sacs a creature, which works with Grave Pact, Martyr's Bond, Savra, Queen of the Golgari (if you sacrifice a black creature, mainly), and LTB effects like Solemn Simulacrum. And then it reanimates, which is great with ETBs like (again) Solemn Simulacrum, Angel of Despair, Ashen Rider, and Sylvan Primo—oh, wait. Problem is, I can't find room for it. I think this one may have to wait for now.
